rooms.name: Entrance Hall
rooms.description: The entry features a robust reception area with concrete finishes, large windows for natural light and ventilation, and minimal decoration in keeping with Brutalist aesthetics. Vastu compliance: North-facing entrance to invite positive energy.

rooms.name: Living Room
rooms.description: A spacious living room with exposed concrete structural elements, high ceilings, and a central open layout that connects to the kitchen area. Designed for comfortable family gatherings; positioned in the east to harness morning sunlight per Vastu guidelines.

rooms.name: Dining Area
rooms.description: Integrated dining space within the living room or adjacent to it, featuring a large concrete table and stone accents. The arrangement adheres to Vastu by ensuring proper seating alignment and natural light flow.

rooms.name: Master Bedroom
rooms.description: A private master bedroom with ample storage, positioned on the south side for a calm ambiance. Incorporates concrete elements with soft lighting, following Vastu principles that favor bedrooms in the southern zone.

rooms.name: Second Bedroom
rooms.description: Additional sleeping area designed for either children or guests, ensuring privacy and comfort while maintaining the Brutalist style through raw materials and simple forms. Positioned adjacent to master bedroom for ease of access.

rooms.name: Bathroom
rooms.description: A functional bathroom equipped with modern fixtures, located conveniently near bedrooms; its orientation is mindful of Vastu by avoiding water flow towards living spaces.

rooms.name: Kitchen
rooms.description: An open-plan kitchen area featuring concrete countertops and durable finishes. Positioned in the northeast to align with Vastu principles for prosperity and creativity.

openings.details: Large, reinforced steel door framed with concrete arches designed to withstand the elements while preserving Brutalist style. Ensures smooth entry flow in line with Vastu.
Expansive window openings that allow ample natural light while maintaining thermal comfort; windows are designed to align with Vastu principles for energy flow.
A small balcony offering a view of the garden, constructed with exposed concrete balustrades. Provides natural ventilation and an outdoor extension in keeping with Brutalist aesthetics.
